label: Google Slides
description: Arcade.dev LLM tools for Google Slides

tools.name: CommentOnPresentation
tools.description: Comment on a specific slide by its index in a Google Slides presentation.

parameters.name: presentation_id
parameters.description: The ID of the presentation to comment on

parameters.name: comment_text
parameters.description: The comment to add to the slide

output.description: The comment's ID, presentationId, and slideNumber in a dictionary

tools.name: CreatePresentation
tools.description:
Create a new Google Slides presentation
The first slide will be populated with the specified title and subtitle.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the presentation to create

parameters.name: subtitle
parameters.description: The subtitle of the presentation to create

output.description: The created presentation's title, presentationId, and presentationUrl

tools.name: CreateSlide
tools.description: Create a new slide at the end of the specified presentation

parameters.name: presentation_id
parameters.description: The ID of the presentation to create the slide in

parameters.name: slide_title
parameters.description: The title of the slide to create

parameters.name: slide_body
parameters.description: The body (text) of the slide to create

output.description: A URL to the created slide

tools.name: GenerateGoogleFilePickerUrl
tools.description:
Generate a Google File Picker URL for user-driven file selection and authorization.

This tool generates a URL that directs the end-user to a Google File Picker interface where
where they can select or upload Google Drive files. Users can grant permission to access their
Drive files, providing a secure and authorized way to interact with their files.

This is particularly useful when prior tools (e.g., those accessing or modifying
Google Docs, Google Sheets, etc.) encountered failures due to file non-existence
(Requested entity was not found) or permission errors. Once the user completes the file
picker flow, the prior tool can be retried.

Suggest this tool to users when they are surprised or confused that the file they are
searching for or attempting to access cannot be found.

output.description: Google File Picker URL for user file selection and permission granting

tools.name: GetPresentationAsMarkdown
tools.description:
Get the specified Google Slides presentation and convert it to markdown.

Only retrieves the text content of the presentation and formats it as markdown.

parameters.name: presentation_id
parameters.description: The ID of the presentation to retrieve.

output.description: The presentation textual content as markdown

tools.name: ListPresentationComments
tools.description: List all comments on the specified Google Slides presentation.

parameters.name: presentation_id
parameters.description: The ID of the presentation to list comments for

parameters.name: include_deleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted comments in the results. Defaults to False.

tools.name: SearchPresentations
tools.description:
Searches for presentations in the user's Google Drive.
Excludes presentations that are in the trash.

parameters.name: presentation_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must be in the presentation title or content. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: presentation_not_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must NOT be in the presentation title or content. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: search_only_in_shared_drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the shared drive to restrict the search to. If provided, the search will only return presentations from this drive. Defaults to None, which searches across all drives.

parameters.name: include_shared_drives
parameters.description: Whether to include presentations from shared drives. Defaults to False (searches only in the user's 'My Drive').

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_presentations
parameters.description: Whether to include presentations from the organization's domain. This is applicable to admin users who have permissions to view organization-wide presentations in a Google Workspace account. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort order. Defaults to listing the most recently modified presentations first. If presentation_contains or presentation_not_contains is provided, then the order_by will be ignored.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of presentations to list

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: The pagination token to continue a previous request

output.description: A dictionary containing 'presentations_count' (number of presentations returned) and 'presentations' (a list of presentation details including 'kind', 'mimeType', 'id', and 'name' for each presentation)

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description:
Get comprehensive user profile and Google Slides environment information.

This tool provides detailed information about the authenticated user including
their name, email, profile picture, Google Slides access permissions, and other
important profile details from Google services.

output.description: Get comprehensive user profile and Google Slides environment information.

summary:
Arcade.dev provides a powerful toolkit for Google Slides, enabling seamless integration and manipulation of presentations within Google Drive. This toolkit allows developers to automate various tasks related to presentation management, enhancing productivity and collaboration.

**Capabilities**
- Generate, modify, and comment on slides within presentations.
- Create new Google Slides presentations with specified content.
- Retrieve presentations and convert them to markdown format.
- Search for and list presentations in the user's Google Drive.
- Access comprehensive user profile information and permissions.

**OAuth**
- Provider: Google
- Scopes: [https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file, https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email, https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.profile]
